title: Area code 586
text:
Area code 586 is the <a href="telephone">telephone</a> <a href="area%20code">area code</a> serving much of <a href="Macomb%20County%2C%20Michigan">Macomb County, Michigan</a>, introduced in 2001 as a split from <a href="area%20code%20810">area code 810</a>. Its territory was originally part of <a href="area%20code%20313">area code 313</a>.
History.
Macomb County was originally served by Detroit's <a href="area%20code%20313">area code 313</a>, one of the <a href="List%20of%20original%20NANP%20area%20codes">original 86 area codes</a> in the <a href="North%20American%20Numbering%20Plan">North American Numbering Plan</a>. In 1993, <a href="area%20code%20810">area code 810</a> was <a href="Split%20plan">split</a> from 313; the service area of 810 initially included all of the former 313 outside of <a href="Monroe%20County%2C%20Michigan">Monroe</a>, <a href="Wayne%20County%2C%20Michigan">Wayne</a>, and <a href="Washtenaw%20County%2C%20Michigan">Washtenaw</a> counties. 
In 1997, <a href="Oakland%20County%2C%20Michigan">Oakland County</a>, bordering Macomb County to the west, was split from area code 810 as <a href="Area%20codes%20248%20and%20947">area code 248</a>. Area code 586 was first proposed as an <a href="Overlay%20plan">overlay</a> for the 810 territory, to be implemented in 2000. However, overlays were still a new concept at this time, and met with some resistance due to the need for <a href="ten-digit%20dialing">ten-digit dialing</a>. In the face of intense opposition to the overlay proposal, 586 was instead implemented as a split, with most of Macomb County getting the new area code. The area code was introduced on September 22, 2001. <a href="Permissive%20dialing">Permissive dialing</a> of 810 continued until March 23, 2002.
